edu.rit.gpu

Class Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.Module

  • public class Module
extends Object
    Class Module encapsulates a module that contains GPU kernel functions and data. To use a module:

    1. Construct an instance of class Module by calling the getModule() method on a Gpu object.

    2. Call methods on the Module object to perform module operations, such as:

    3. Get a proxy for a GPU kernel function —
      • getKernel()

    4. Get a reference to a statically allocated variable or array in GPU memory —
      • getByteVbl(), getByteArray()
      • getShortVbl(), getShortArray()
      • getIntVbl(), getIntArray()
      • getLongVbl(), getLongArray()
      • getFloatVbl(), getFloatArray()
      • getDoubleVbl(), getDoubleArray()
      • getStructVbl(), getStructArray()

    Study the source code of the classes in package edu.rit.pj2.example to see examples of Parallel Java 2 GPU programs.

    Note: Class Module is not multiple thread safe. It is assumed that only one thread at a time will call methods on a Module object.

    • Method Detail

      • getKernel

        public <T extends Kernel> T getKernel(Class<T> intf)
        Get a GPU kernel function from this module. The kernel function is specified by the given interface, which must extend interface Kernel. The kernel function's name is that of the method declared in the given interface. The return value is a proxy object that implements the given interface. For further information, see interface Kernel.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Kernel function interface.
        Parameters:
        intf - Kernel function interface's class object.
        Returns:
        Proxy object for invoking kernel function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if intf does not meet the requirements for a kernel function interface.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getByteVbl

        public GpuByteVbl getByteVbl(String name)
        Create a new GPU byte variable mirroring the given global variable in this module. The variable in CPU memory, namely the item field, is initialized to zero. The variable in GPU memory is not initialized.
        Parameters:
        name - Global variable name.
        Returns:
        GPU byte variable.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if name is null.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getByteArray

        public GpuByteArray getByteArray(String name,
                        int len)
        Create a new GPU byte array mirroring the given global variable in this module. The entire GPU array is mirrored in the CPU. The array in CPU memory, namely the item field, is initialized to zeroes. The array in GPU memory is not initialized.
        Parameters:
        name - Global variable name.
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        Returns:
        GPU byte array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if name is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getByteArray(String,int,int)

      • getByteArray

        public GpuByteArray getByteArray(String name,
                        int len,
                        int cpulen)
        Create a new GPU byte array mirroring the given global variable in this module, of which the given portion is mirrored in the CPU. If cpulen = 0, then none of the array is mirrored in the CPU. The array in CPU memory, namely the item field, is initialized to zeroes. The array in GPU memory is not initialized.
        Parameters:
        name - Global variable name.
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        cpulen - Number of array elements to mirror in the CPU.
        Returns:
        GPU byte array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if name is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1, cpulen < 0, or cpulen > len.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getByteArray(String,int)

      • getStructVbl

        public <T extends Struct> GpuStructVbl<T> getStructVbl(String name,
                                              Class<T> type)
        Create a new GPU struct variable mirroring the given global variable in this module. The variable in CPU memory, namely the item field, is initialized to null. The variable in GPU memory is not initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.
        Parameters:
        name - Global variable name.
        type - Class object for Java data type.
        Returns:
        GPU struct variable.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if name or type is null.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getStructArray

        public <T extends Struct> GpuStructArray<T> getStructArray(String name,
                                                  Class<T> type,
                                                  int len)
        Create a new GPU struct array mirroring the given global variable in this module. The entire GPU array is mirrored in the CPU. The array elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to null. The array elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.
        Parameters:
        name - Global variable name.
        type - Class object for Java data type.
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        Returns:
        GPU struct array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if name or type is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getStructArray(String,Class,int,int)

      • getStructArray

        public <T extends Struct> GpuStructArray<T> getStructArray(String name,
                                                  Class<T> type,
                                                  int len,
                                                  int cpulen)
        Create a new GPU struct array mirroring the given global variable in this module, of which the given portion is mirrored in the CPU. If cpulen = 0, then none of the array is mirrored in the CPU. The array elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to null. The array elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.
        Parameters:
        name - Global variable name.
        type - Class object for Java data type.
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        cpulen - Number of array elements to mirror in the CPU.
        Returns:
        GPU struct array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if name or type is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1, cpulen < 0, or cpulen > len.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getStructArray(String,Class,int)

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        Finalize this module.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
